auth_token.description: ArgoCD authentication token, takes precedence over `username`/`password`. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_AUTH_TOKEN` environment variable.

cert_file.description: Additional root CA certificates file to add to the client TLS connection pool.

config_path.description: Override the default config path of `$HOME/.config/argocd/config`. Only relevant when `use_local_config`. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_CONFIG_PATH` environment variable.

context.description: Context to choose when using a local ArgoCD config file. Only relevant when `use_local_config`. Can be set through `ARGOCD_CONTEXT` environment variable.

core.description:
Configure direct access using Kubernetes API server.

  **Warning**: this feature works by starting a local ArgoCD API server that talks directly to the Kubernetes API using the **current context in the default kubeconfig** (`~/.kube/config`). This behavior cannot be overridden using either environment variables or the `kubernetes` block in the provider configuration at present).

  If the server fails to start (e.g. your kubeconfig is misconfigured) then the provider will fail as a result of the `argocd` module forcing it to exit and no logs will be available to help you debug this. The error message will be similar to
  > `The plugin encountered an error, and failed to respond to the plugin.(*GRPCProvider).ReadResource call. The plugin logs may contain more details.`

  To debug this, you will need to login via the ArgoCD CLI using `argocd login --core` and then running an operation. E.g. `argocd app list`.

grpc_web.description: Whether to use gRPC web proxy client. Useful if Argo CD server is behind proxy which does not support HTTP2.

grpc_web_root_path.description: Use the gRPC web proxy client and set the web root, e.g. `argo-cd`. Useful if the Argo CD server is behind a proxy at a non-root path.

headers.description: Additional headers to add to each request to the ArgoCD server.

insecure.description: Whether to skip TLS server certificate. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_INSECURE` environment variable.

password.description: Authentication password. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_AUTH_PASSWORD` environment variable.

plain_text.description: Whether to initiate an unencrypted connection to ArgoCD server.

port_forward.description: Connect to a random argocd-server port using port forwarding.

port_forward_with_namespace.description: Namespace name which should be used for port forwarding.

server_addr.description: ArgoCD server address with port. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_SERVER` environment variable.

use_local_config.description: Use the authentication settings found in the local config file. Useful when you have previously logged in using SSO. Conflicts with `auth_token`, `username` and `password`.

username.description: Authentication username. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_AUTH_USERNAME` environment variable.

client_certificate.description: PEM-encoded client certificate for TLS authentication. Can be sourced from `KUBE_CLIENT_CERT_DATA`.

client_key.description: PEM-encoded client certificate key for TLS authentication. Can be sourced from `KUBE_CLIENT_KEY_DATA`.

cluster_ca_certificate.description: PEM-encoded root certificates bundle for TLS authentication. Can be sourced from `KUBE_CLUSTER_CA_CERT_DATA`.

config_context.description: Context to choose from the config file. Can be sourced from `KUBE_CTX`.

host.description: The hostname (in form of URI) of the Kubernetes API. Can be sourced from `KUBE_HOST`.

insecure.description: Whether server should be accessed without verifying the TLS certificate. Can be sourced from `KUBE_INSECURE`.

password.description: The password to use for HTTP basic authentication when accessing the Kubernetes API. Can be sourced from `KUBE_PASSWORD`.

token.description: Token to authenticate an service account. Can be sourced from `KUBE_TOKEN`.

username.description: The username to use for HTTP basic authentication when accessing the Kubernetes API. Can be sourced from `KUBE_USER`.

api_version.description: API version to use when decoding the ExecCredentials resource, e.g. `client.authentication.k8s.io/v1beta1`.

args.description: Map of environment variables to set when executing the plugin.

env.description: List of arguments to pass when executing the plugin.

block.description: Configuration block to use an [exec-based credential plugin](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/access-authn-authz/authentication/#client-go-credential-plugins), e.g. call an external command to receive user credentials.

Kubernetes configuration overrides.  Only relevant when `port_forward = true` or `port_forward_with_namespace = "foo"`. The kubeconfig file that is used can be overridden using the [`KUBECONFIG` environment variable](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/organize-cluster-access-kubeconfig/#the-kubeconfig-environment-variable)).

account.description: Account name. Defaults to the current account. I.e. the account configured on the `provider` block.

expires_at.description: If `expires_in` is set, Unix timestamp upon which the token will expire.

expires_in.description: Duration before the token will expire. Valid time units are `ns`, `us` (or `µs`), `ms`, `s`, `m`, `h`. E.g. `12h`, `7d`. Default: No expiration.

issued_at.description: Unix timestamp at which the token was issued.

renew_after.description: Duration to control token silent regeneration based on token age. Valid time units are `ns`, `us` (or `µs`), `ms`, `s`, `m`, `h`. If set, then the token will be regenerated if it is older than `renew_after`. I.e. if `currentDate - issued_at > renew_after`.

renew_before.description: Duration to control token silent regeneration based on remaining token lifetime. If `expires_in` is set, Terraform will regenerate the token if `expires_at - currentDate < renew_before`. Valid time units are `ns`, `us` (or `µs`), `ms`, `s`, `m`, `h`.

block.description: Manages ArgoCD [account](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user-guide/commands/argocd_account/) JWT tokens.

cascade.description: Whether to applying cascading deletion when application is removed.

status.description: Status information for the application. **Note**: this is not guaranteed to be up to date immediately after creating/updating an application unless `wait=true`.

wait.description: Upon application creation or update, wait for application health/sync status to be healthy/Synced, upon application deletion, wait for application to be removed, when set to true. Wait timeouts are controlled by Terraform Create, Update and Delete resource timeouts (all default to 5 minutes). **Note**: if ArgoCD decides not to sync an application (e.g. because the project to which the application belongs has a `sync_window` applied) then you will experience an expected timeout event if `wait = true`.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map stored with the applications.argoproj.io that may be used to store arbitrary metadata. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

generation.description: A sequence number representing a specific generation of the desired state.

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the applications.argoproj.io. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels

name.description: Name of the applications.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

namespace.description: Namespace of the applications.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces/

resource_version.description: An opaque value that represents the internal version of this applications.argoproj.io that can be used by clients to determine when applications.argoproj.io has changed. Read more: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency

uid.description: The unique in time and space value for this applications.argoproj.io. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#uids

block.description: Standard Kubernetes object metadata. For more info see the [Kubernetes reference](https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata).

project.description: The project the application belongs to. Defaults to `default`.

revision_history_limit.description: Limits the number of items kept in the application's revision history, which is used for informational purposes as well as for rollbacks to previous versions. This should only be changed in exceptional circumstances. Setting to zero will store no history. This will reduce storage used. Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it. Default is 10.

name.description: Name of the target cluster. Can be used instead of `server`.

namespace.description: Target namespace for the application's resources. The namespace will only be set for namespace-scoped resources that have not set a value for .metadata.namespace.

server.description: URL of the target cluster and must be set to the Kubernetes control plane API.

block.description: Reference to the Kubernetes server and namespace in which the application will be deployed.

group.description: The Kubernetes resource Group to match for.

jq_path_expressions.description: List of JQ path expression strings targeting the field(s) to ignore.

json_pointers.description: List of JSONPaths strings targeting the field(s) to ignore.

kind.description: The Kubernetes resource Kind to match for.

name.description: The Kubernetes resource Name to match for.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes resource Namespace to match for.

block.description: Resources and their fields which should be ignored during comparison. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/diffing/#application-level-configuration.
List of information (URLs, email addresses, and plain text) that relates to the application.

chart.description: Helm chart name. Must be specified for applications sourced from a Helm repo.

path.description: Directory path within the repository. Only valid for applications sourced from Git.

ref.description: Reference to another `source` within defined sources. See associated documentation on [Helm value files from external Git repository](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/multiple_sources/#helm-value-files-from-external-git-repository) regarding combining `ref` with `path` and/or `chart`.

repo_url.description: URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests.

target_revision.description: Revision of the source to sync the application to. In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD. In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.

exclude.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly excluded from being used during manifest generation. This takes precedence over the `include` field. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{config.yaml,env-use2/*}'

include.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly included during manifest generation. If this field is set, only matching manifests will be included. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{*.yml,*.yaml}'

recurse.description: Whether to scan a directory recursively for manifests.

code.description: Determines whether the variable should be evaluated as jsonnet code or treated as string.

block.description: List of Jsonnet External Variables.

skip_crds.description: Whether to skip custom resource definition installation step (Helm's [--skip-crds](https://helm.sh/docs/chart_best_practices/custom_resource_definitions/)).

sync_options.description: List of sync options. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/sync-options/.

allow_empty.description: Allows apps have zero live resources.

prune.description: Whether to delete resources from the cluster that are not found in the sources anymore as part of automated sync.

self_heal.description: Whether to revert resources back to their desired state upon modification in the cluster.

block.description: Whether to automatically keep an application synced to the target revision.

annotations.description: Annotations to apply to the namespace.

labels.description: Labels to apply to the namespace.

block.description: Controls metadata in the given namespace (if `CreateNamespace=true`).

limit.description: Maximum number of attempts for retrying a failed sync. If set to 0, no retries will be performed.

duration.description: Duration is the amount to back off. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

factor.description: Factor to multiply the base duration after each failed retry.

max_duration.description: Maximum amount of time allowed for the backoff strategy. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

block.description: Controls how to backoff on subsequent retries of failed syncs.
Controls failed sync retry behavior.

config_map_ref.description: ConfigMap with the duck type definitions needed to retrieve the data this includes apiVersion(group/version), kind, matchKey and validation settings.

name.description: Resource name of the kind, group and version, defined in the `config_map_ref`.

requeue_after_seconds.description: How often to check for changes (in seconds). Default: 3min.

values.description: Arbitrary string key-value pairs which are passed directly as parameters to the template.

match_labels.description: A map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of `match_expressions`, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: A key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators ard `In`, `NotIn`, `Exists` and `DoesNotExist`.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

block.description: A list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

name.description: Name of the plugin. Only set the plugin name if the plugin is defined in `argocd-cm`. If the plugin is defined as a sidecar, omit the name. The plugin will be automatically matched with the Application according to the plugin's discovery rules.

block.description: Environment variables passed to the plugin.
Config management plugin specific options.
Location of the application's manifests or chart.

sync_options.description: List of sync options. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/sync-options/.

allow_empty.description: Allows apps have zero live resources.

prune.description: Whether to delete resources from the cluster that are not found in the sources anymore as part of automated sync.

self_heal.description: Whether to revert resources back to their desired state upon modification in the cluster.

block.description: Whether to automatically keep an application synced to the target revision.

annotations.description: Annotations to apply to the namespace.

labels.description: Labels to apply to the namespace.

block.description: Controls metadata in the given namespace (if `CreateNamespace=true`).

limit.description: Maximum number of attempts for retrying a failed sync. If set to 0, no retries will be performed.

duration.description: Duration is the amount to back off. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

factor.description: Factor to multiply the base duration after each failed retry.

max_duration.description: Maximum amount of time allowed for the backoff strategy. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

block.description: Controls how to backoff on subsequent retries of failed syncs.
Controls failed sync retry behavior.
Controls when and how a sync will be performed.
The application specification.
Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.
The [cluster generator](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Cluster/) produces parameters based on the list of items found within the cluster secret.

repo_url.description: URL to the repository to use.

revision.description: Revision of the source repository to use.

exclude.description: Flag indicating whether or not the directory should be excluded when templating.

path.description: Path in the repository.

block.description: List of directories in the source repository to use when template the Application..

path.description: Path to the file in the repository.

block.description: List of files in the source repository to use when template the Application.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map that may be used to store arbitrary metadata for the resulting Application.

finalizers.description: List of finalizers to apply to the resulting Application.

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the resulting Application.

namespace.description: Namespace of the resulting Application

block.description: Kubernetes object metadata for templated Application.

project.description: The project the application belongs to. Defaults to `default`.

revision_history_limit.description: Limits the number of items kept in the application's revision history, which is used for informational purposes as well as for rollbacks to previous versions. This should only be changed in exceptional circumstances. Setting to zero will store no history. This will reduce storage used. Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it. Default is 10.

name.description: Name of the target cluster. Can be used instead of `server`.

namespace.description: Target namespace for the application's resources. The namespace will only be set for namespace-scoped resources that have not set a value for .metadata.namespace.

server.description: URL of the target cluster and must be set to the Kubernetes control plane API.

block.description: Reference to the Kubernetes server and namespace in which the application will be deployed.

group.description: The Kubernetes resource Group to match for.

name.description: The Kubernetes resource Name to match for.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes resource Namespace to match for.

block.description: Resources and their fields which should be ignored during comparison. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/diffing/#application-level-configuration.
List of information (URLs, email addresses, and plain text) that relates to the application.

chart.description: Helm chart name. Must be specified for applications sourced from a Helm repo.

path.description: Directory path within the repository. Only valid for applications sourced from Git.

ref.description: Reference to another `source` within defined sources. See associated documentation on [Helm value files from external Git repository](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/multiple_sources/#helm-value-files-from-external-git-repository) regarding combining `ref` with `path` and/or `chart`.

repo_url.description: URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests.

target_revision.description: Revision of the source to sync the application to. In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD. In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.

exclude.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly excluded from being used during manifest generation. This takes precedence over the `include` field. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{config.yaml,env-use2/*}'

include.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly included during manifest generation. If this field is set, only matching manifests will be included. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{*.yml,*.yaml}'

recurse.description: Whether to scan a directory recursively for manifests.

code.description: Determines whether the variable should be evaluated as jsonnet code or treated as string.

block.description: List of Jsonnet External Variables.

The application specification.
Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.

[List generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-List/) generate parameters based on an arbitrary list of key/value pairs (as long as the values are string values).

config_map_ref.description: ConfigMap with the duck type definitions needed to retrieve the data this includes apiVersion(group/version), kind, matchKey and validation settings.

name.description: Resource name of the kind, group and version, defined in the `config_map_ref`.

requeue_after_seconds.description: How often to check for changes (in seconds). Default: 3min.

values.description: Arbitrary string key-value pairs which are passed directly as parameters to the template.

match_labels.description: A map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of `match_expressions`, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: A key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators ard `In`, `NotIn`, `Exists` and `DoesNotExist`.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

block.description: A list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.
Label selector used to find the resource defined in the `config_map_ref`. Alternative to `name`.

name_suffix.description: Suffix appended to resources for Kustomize apps.

version.description: Version of Kustomize to use for rendering manifests.

block.description: Kustomize specific options.

name.description: Name of the plugin. Only set the plugin name if the plugin is defined in `argocd-cm`. If the plugin is defined as a sidecar, omit the name. The plugin will be automatically matched with the Application according to the plugin's discovery rules.

block.description: Environment variables passed to the plugin.
Config management plugin specific options.
Location of the application's manifests or chart.

sync_options.description: List of sync options. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/sync-options/.

allow_empty.description: Allows apps have zero live resources.

prune.description: Whether to delete resources from the cluster that are not found in the sources anymore as part of automated sync.

self_heal.description: Whether to revert resources back to their desired state upon modification in the cluster.

block.description: Whether to automatically keep an application synced to the target revision.

annotations.description: Annotations to apply to the namespace.

labels.description: Labels to apply to the namespace.

block.description: Controls metadata in the given namespace (if `CreateNamespace=true`).

limit.description: Maximum number of attempts for retrying a failed sync. If set to 0, no retries will be performed.

duration.description: Duration is the amount to back off. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

factor.description: Factor to multiply the base duration after each failed retry.

max_duration.description: Maximum amount of time allowed for the backoff strategy. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

block.description: Controls how to backoff on subsequent retries of failed syncs.
Controls failed sync retry behavior.
Controls when and how a sync will be performed.
The application specification.
Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.
The [cluster generator](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Cluster/) produces parameters based on the list of items found within the cluster secret.

repo_url.description: URL to the repository to use.

revision.description: Revision of the source repository to use.

exclude.description: Flag indicating whether or not the directory should be excluded when templating.

path.description: Path in the repository.

block.description: List of directories in the source repository to use when template the Application..

path.description: Path to the file in the repository.

block.description: List of files in the source repository to use when template the Application.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map that may be used to store arbitrary metadata for the resulting Application.

finalizers.description: List of finalizers to apply to the resulting Application.

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the resulting Application.

namespace.description: Namespace of the resulting Application

block.description: Kubernetes object metadata for templated Application.

project.description: The project the application belongs to. Defaults to `default`.

revision_history_limit.description: Limits the number of items kept in the application's revision history, which is used for informational purposes as well as for rollbacks to previous versions. This should only be changed in exceptional circumstances. Setting to zero will store no history. This will reduce storage used. Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it. Default is 10.

name.description: Name of the target cluster. Can be used instead of `server`.

namespace.description: Target namespace for the application's resources. The namespace will only be set for namespace-scoped resources that have not set a value for .metadata.namespace.

server.description: URL of the target cluster and must be set to the Kubernetes control plane API.

block.description: Reference to the Kubernetes server and namespace in which the application will be deployed.

group.description: The Kubernetes resource Group to match for.

jq_path_expressions.description: List of JQ path expression strings targeting the field(s) to ignore.

json_pointers.description: List of JSONPaths strings targeting the field(s) to ignore.

kind.description: The Kubernetes resource Kind to match for.

name.description: The Kubernetes resource Name to match for.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes resource Namespace to match for.

block.description: Resources and their fields which should be ignored during comparison. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/diffing/#application-level-configuration.
List of information (URLs, email addresses, and plain text) that relates to the application.

chart.description: Helm chart name. Must be specified for applications sourced from a Helm repo.

path.description: Directory path within the repository. Only valid for applications sourced from Git.

ref.description: Reference to another `source` within defined sources. See associated documentation on [Helm value files from external Git repository](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/multiple_sources/#helm-value-files-from-external-git-repository) regarding combining `ref` with `path` and/or `chart`.

repo_url.description: URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests.

target_revision.description: Revision of the source to sync the application to. In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD. In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.

exclude.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly excluded from being used during manifest generation. This takes precedence over the `include` field. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{config.yaml,env-use2/*}'

include.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly included during manifest generation. If this field is set, only matching manifests will be included. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{*.yml,*.yaml}'

recurse.description: Whether to scan a directory recursively for manifests.

code.description: Determines whether the variable should be evaluated as jsonnet code or treated as string.

block.description: List of Jsonnet External Variables.

code.description: Determines whether the variable should be evaluated as jsonnet code or treated as string.

block.description: List of Jsonnet Top-level Arguments
Jsonnet specific options.
Path/directory specific options.

ignore_missing_value_files.description: Prevents 'helm template' from failing when `value_files` do not exist locally by not appending them to 'helm template --values'.

pass_credentials.description: If true then adds '--pass-credentials' to Helm commands to pass credentials to all domains.

release_name.description: Helm release name. If omitted it will use the application name.

skip_crds.description: Whether to skip custom resource definition installation step (Helm's [--skip-crds](https://helm.sh/docs/chart_best_practices/custom_resource_definitions/)).

value_files.description: List of Helm value files to use when generating a template.

values.description: Helm values to be passed to 'helm template', typically defined as a block.

path.description: Path to the file containing the values for the Helm parameter.

block.description: File parameters for the helm template.

force_string.description: Determines whether to tell Helm to interpret booleans and numbers as strings.

block.description: Helm parameters which are passed to the helm template command upon manifest generation.

The application specification.
Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.

[List generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-List/) generate parameters based on an arbitrary list of key/value pairs (as long as the values are string values).

config_map_ref.description: ConfigMap with the duck type definitions needed to retrieve the data this includes apiVersion(group/version), kind, matchKey and validation settings.

name.description: Resource name of the kind, group and version, defined in the `config_map_ref`.

requeue_after_seconds.description: How often to check for changes (in seconds). Default: 3min.

values.description: Arbitrary string key-value pairs which are passed directly as parameters to the template.

match_labels.description: A map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of `match_expressions`, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: A key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators ard `In`, `NotIn`, `Exists` and `DoesNotExist`.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

block.description: A list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.
Label selector used to find the resource defined in the `config_map_ref`. Alternative to `name`.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map that may be used to store arbitrary metadata for the resulting Application.

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the resulting Application.

namespace.description: Namespace of the resulting Application

Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.
The [cluster generator](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Cluster/) produces parameters based on the list of items found within the cluster secret.

repo_url.description: URL to the repository to use.

revision.description: Revision of the source repository to use.

revision_history_limit.description: Limits the number of items kept in the application's revision history, which is used for informational purposes as well as for rollbacks to previous versions. This should only be changed in exceptional circumstances. Setting to zero will store no history. This will reduce storage used. Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it. Default is 10.

See associated documentation on [Helm value files from external Git repository](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/multiple_sources/#helm-value-files-from-external-git-repository) regarding combining `ref` with `path` and/or `chart`.

repo_url.description: URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests.

target_revision.description: Revision of the source to sync the application to. In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD. In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.

exclude.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly excluded from being used during manifest generation. This takes precedence over the `include` field. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{config.yaml,env-use2/*}'

include.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly included during manifest generation. If this field is set, only matching manifests will be included. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{*.yml,*.yaml}'

recurse.description: Whether to scan a directory recursively for manifests.

ref.description: Reference to another `source` within defined sources. See associated documentation on [Helm value files from external Git repository](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/multiple_sources/#helm-value-files-from-external-git-repository) regarding combining `ref` with `path` and/or `chart`.

repo_url.description: URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests.

target_revision.description: Revision of the source to sync the application to. In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD. In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.

exclude.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly excluded from being used during manifest generation. This takes precedence over the `include` field. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{config.yaml,env-use2/*}'

include.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly included during manifest generation. If this field is set, only matching manifests will be included. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{*.yml,*.yaml}'

recurse.description: Whether to scan a directory recursively for manifests.

code.description: Determines whether the variable should be evaluated as jsonnet code or treated as string.

block.description: List of Jsonnet External Variables.

code.description: Determines whether the variable should be evaluated as jsonnet code or treated as string.

block.description: List of Jsonnet Top-level Arguments
Jsonnet specific options.
Path/directory specific options.

ignore_missing_value_files.description: Prevents 'helm template' from failing when `value_files` do not exist locally by not appending them to 'helm template --values'.

pass_credentials.description: If true then adds '--pass-credentials' to Helm commands to pass credentials to all domains.

release_name.description: Helm release name. If omitted it will use the application name.

skip_crds.description: Whether to skip custom resource definition installation step (Helm's [--skip-crds](https://helm.sh/docs/chart_best_practices/custom_resource_definitions/)).

value_files.description: List of Helm value files to use when generating a template.

values.description: Helm values to be passed to 'helm template', typically defined as a block.

path.description: Path to the file containing the values for the Helm parameter.

block.description: File parameters for the helm template.

force_string.description: Determines whether to tell Helm to interpret booleans and numbers as strings.

block.description: Helm parameters which are passed to the helm template command upon manifest generation.
Helm specific options.

common_annotations.description: List of additional annotations to add to rendered manifests.

common_labels.description: List of additional labels to add to rendered manifests.

images.description: List of Kustomize image override specifications.

name_prefix.description: Prefix appended to resources for Kustomize apps.

name_suffix.description: Suffix appended to resources for Kustomize apps.

version.description: Version of Kustomize to use for rendering manifests.

block.description: Kustomize specific options.

name.description: Name of the plugin. Only set the plugin name if the plugin is defined in `argocd-cm`. If the plugin is defined as a sidecar, omit the name. The plugin will be automatically matched with the Application according to the plugin's discovery rules.

block.description: Environment variables passed to the plugin.
Config management plugin specific options.
Location of the application's manifests or chart.

sync_options.description: List of sync options. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/sync-options/.

allow_empty.description: Allows apps have zero live resources.

prune.description: Whether to delete resources from the cluster that are not found in the sources anymore as part of automated sync.

self_heal.description: Whether to revert resources back to their desired state upon modification in the cluster.

block.description: Whether to automatically keep an application synced to the target revision.

annotations.description: Annotations to apply to the namespace.

labels.description: Labels to apply to the namespace.

block.description: Controls metadata in the given namespace (if `CreateNamespace=true`).

limit.description: Maximum number of attempts for retrying a failed sync. If set to 0, no retries will be performed.

duration.description: Duration is the amount to back off. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

factor.description: Factor to multiply the base duration after each failed retry.

max_duration.description: Maximum amount of time allowed for the backoff strategy. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

block.description: Controls how to backoff on subsequent retries of failed syncs.
Controls failed sync retry behavior.
Controls when and how a sync will be performed.
The application specification.
Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.

[SCM Provider generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-SCM-Provider/) uses the API of an SCMaaS provider to automatically discover repositories within an organization.

match_labels.description: A map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of `match_expressions`, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: A key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators ard `In`, `NotIn`, `Exists` and `DoesNotExist`.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

block.description: A list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.
The Selector allows to post-filter based on generated values using the kubernetes common labelSelector format.
Child generator. Generators are responsible for generating parameters, which are then combined by the parent matrix generator into the template fields of the ApplicationSet resource.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map that may be used to store arbitrary metadata for the resulting Application.

finalizers.description: List of finalizers to apply to the resulting Application.

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the resulting Application.

namespace.description: Namespace of the resulting Application

block.description: Kubernetes object metadata for templated Application.

project.description: The project the application belongs to. Defaults to `default`.

revision_history_limit.description: Limits the number of items kept in the application's revision history, which is used for informational purposes as well as for rollbacks to previous versions. This should only be changed in exceptional circumstances. Setting to zero will store no history. This will reduce storage used. Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it. Default is 10.

name.description: Name of the target cluster. Can be used instead of `server`.

namespace.description: Target namespace for the application's resources. The namespace will only be set for namespace-scoped resources that have not set a value for .metadata.namespace.

server.description: URL of the target cluster and must be set to the Kubernetes control plane API.

block.description: Reference to the Kubernetes server and namespace in which the application will be deployed.

group.description: The Kubernetes resource Group to match for.

jq_path_expressions.description: List of JQ path expression strings targeting the field(s) to ignore.

json_pointers.description: List of JSONPaths strings targeting the field(s) to ignore.

kind.description: The Kubernetes resource Kind to match for.

name.description: The Kubernetes resource Name to match for.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes resource Namespace to match for.

block.description: Resources and their fields which should be ignored during comparison. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/diffing/#application-level-configuration.

The application specification.
Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.

[Matrix generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Matrix/) combine the parameters generated by two child generators, iterating through every combination of each generator's generated parameters. Take note of the [restrictions](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Matrix/#restrictions) regarding their usage - particularly regarding nesting matrix generators.

merge_keys.description: Keys to merge into resulting parameter set.

config_map_ref.description: ConfigMap with the duck type definitions needed to retrieve the data this includes apiVersion(group/version), kind, matchKey and validation settings.

name.description: Resource name of the kind, group and version, defined in the `config_map_ref`.

requeue_after_seconds.description: How often to check for changes (in seconds). Default: 3min.

values.description: Arbitrary string key-value pairs which are passed directly as parameters to the template.

match_labels.description: A map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of `match_expressions`, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: A key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators ard `In`, `NotIn`, `Exists` and `DoesNotExist`.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

block.description: A list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.
Label selector used to find the resource defined in the `config_map_ref`. Alternative to `name`.

This should only be changed in exceptional circumstances. Setting to zero will store no history. This will reduce storage used. Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it. Default is 10.

name.description: Name of the target cluster. Can be used instead of `server`.

namespace.description: Target namespace for the application's resources. The namespace will only be set for namespace-scoped resources that have not set a value for .metadata.namespace.

server.description: URL of the target cluster and must be set to the Kubernetes control plane API.

block.description: Reference to the Kubernetes server and namespace in which the application will be deployed.

group.description: The Kubernetes resource Group to match for.

jq_path_expressions.description: List of JQ path expression strings targeting the field(s) to ignore.

json_pointers.description: List of JSONPaths strings targeting the field(s) to ignore.

kind.description: The Kubernetes resource Kind to match for.

name.description: The Kubernetes resource Name to match for.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes resource Namespace to match for.

block.description: Resources and their fields which should be ignored during comparison. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/diffing/#application-level-configuration.
List of information (URLs, email addresses, and plain text) that relates to the application.

chart.description: Helm chart name. Must be specified for applications sourced from a Helm repo.

path.description: Directory path within the repository. Only valid for applications sourced from Git.

ref.description: Reference to another `source` within defined sources. See associated documentation on [Helm value files from external Git repository](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/multiple_sources/#helm-value-files-from-external-git-repository) regarding combining `ref` with `path` and/or `chart`.

repo_url.description: URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests.

target_revision.description: Revision of the source to sync the application to. In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD. In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.

exclude.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly excluded from being used during manifest generation. This takes precedence over the `include` field. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{config.yaml,env-use2/*}'

include.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly included during manifest generation. If this field is set, only matching manifests will be included. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{*.yml,*.yaml}'

recurse.description: Whether to scan a directory recursively for manifests.

code.description: Determines whether the variable should be evaluated as jsonnet code or treated as string.

block.description: List of Jsonnet External Variables.

release_name.description: Helm release name. If omitted it will use the application name.

skip_crds.description: Whether to skip custom resource definition installation step (Helm's [--skip-crds](https://helm.sh/docs/chart_best_practices/custom_resource_definitions/)).

values.description: Helm values to be passed to 'helm template', typically defined as a block.

path.description: Path to the file containing the values for the Helm parameter.

block.description: File parameters for the helm template.

force_string.description: Determines whether to tell Helm to interpret booleans and numbers as strings.

allow_empty.description: Allows apps have zero live resources.

prune.description: Whether to delete resources from the cluster that are not found in the sources anymore as part of automated sync.

self_heal.description: Whether to revert resources back to their desired state upon modification in the cluster.

annotations.description: Annotations to apply to the namespace.

labels.description: Labels to apply to the namespace.

block.description: Controls metadata in the given namespace (if `CreateNamespace=true`).

limit.description: Maximum number of attempts for retrying a failed sync. If set to 0, no retries will be performed.

duration.description: Duration is the amount to back off. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

factor.description: Factor to multiply the base duration after each failed retry.

max_duration.description: Maximum amount of time allowed for the backoff strategy. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

block.description: Controls how to backoff on subsequent retries of failed syncs.

The application specification.
Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.

[Pull Request generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Pull-Request/) uses the API of an SCMaaS provider to automatically discover open pull requests within a repository.

clone_protocol.description: Which protocol to use for the SCM URL. Default is provider-specific but ssh if possible. Not all providers necessarily support all protocols.

requeue_after_seconds.description: How often to check for changes (in seconds). Default: 3min.

all_branches.description: Scan all branches instead of just the default branch.

api.description: The URL to Azure DevOps. Defaults to https://dev.azure.com.

block.description: The Personal Access Token (PAT) to use when connecting.
Uses the Azure DevOps API to look up eligible repositories based on a team project within an Azure DevOps organization.

all_branches.description: Scan all branches instead of just the default branch.

owner.description: Bitbucket workspace to scan.

user.description: Bitbucket user to use when authenticating. Should have a "member" role to be able to read all repositories and branches.

block.description: The app password to use for the user. See: https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/app-passwords/.
Uses the Bitbucket API V2 to scan a workspace in bitbucket.org.

Config management plugin specific options.
Location of the application's manifests or chart.

sync_options.description: List of sync options. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/sync-options/.

allow_empty.description: Allows apps have zero live resources.

prune.description: Whether to delete resources from the cluster that are not found in the sources anymore as part of automated sync.

self_heal.description: Whether to revert resources back to their desired state upon modification in the cluster.

block.description: Whether to automatically keep an application synced to the target revision.

annotations.description: Annotations to apply to the namespace.

labels.description: Labels to apply to the namespace.

block.description: Controls metadata in the given namespace (if `CreateNamespace=true`).

limit.description: Maximum number of attempts for retrying a failed sync. If set to 0, no retries will be performed.

duration.description: Duration is the amount to back off. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

factor.description: Factor to multiply the base duration after each failed retry.

max_duration.description: Maximum amount of time allowed for the backoff strategy. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

block.description: Controls how to backoff on subsequent retries of failed syncs.
Controls failed sync retry behavior.
Controls when and how a sync will be performed.
The application specification.
Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.

[SCM Provider generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-SCM-Provider/) uses the API of an SCMaaS provider to automatically discover repositories within an organization.

match_labels.description: A map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of `match_expressions`, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: A key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators ard `In`, `NotIn`, `Exists` and `DoesNotExist`.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

block.description: A list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.
The Selector allows to post-filter based on generated values using the kubernetes common labelSelector format.
Child generator. Generators are responsible for generating parameters, which are then combined by the parent merge generator.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map that may be used to store arbitrary metadata for the resulting Application.

finalizers.description: List of finalizers to apply to the resulting Application.

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the resulting Application.

namespace.description: Namespace of the resulting Application

block.description: Kubernetes object metadata for templated Application.

project.description: The project the application belongs to. Defaults to `default`.

revision_history_limit.description: Limits the number of items kept in the application's revision history, which is used for informational purposes as well as for rollbacks to previous versions. This should only be changed in exceptional circumstances. Setting to zero will store no history. This will reduce storage used. Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it. Default is 10.

name.description: Name of the target cluster. Can be used instead of `server`.

namespace.description: Target namespace for the application's resources. The namespace will only be set for namespace-scoped resources that have not set a value for .metadata.namespace.

server.description: URL of the target cluster and must be set to the Kubernetes control plane API.

block.description: Reference to the Kubernetes server and namespace in which the application will be deployed.

group.description: The Kubernetes resource Group to match for.

jq_path_expressions.description: List of JQ path expression strings targeting the field(s) to ignore.

json_pointers.description: List of JSONPaths strings targeting the field(s) to ignore.

kind.description: The Kubernetes resource Kind to match for.

name.description: The Kubernetes resource Name to match for.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes resource Namespace to match for.

block.description: Resources and their fields which should be ignored during comparison. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/diffing/#application-level-configuration.
List of information (URLs, email addresses, and plain text) that relates to the application.

chart.description: Helm chart name. Must be specified for applications sourced from a Helm repo.

path.description: Directory path within the repository. Only valid for applications sourced from Git.

ref.description: Reference to another `source` within defined sources. See associated documentation on [Helm value files from external Git repository](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/multiple_sources/#helm-value-files-from-external-git-repository) regarding combining `ref` with `path` and/or `chart`.

repo_url.description: URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests.

target_revision.description: Revision of the source to sync the application to. In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD. In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.

exclude.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly excluded from being used during manifest generation. This takes precedence over the `include` field. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{config.yaml,env-use2/*}'

include.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly included during manifest generation. If this field is set, only matching manifests will be included. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{*.yml,*.yaml}'

recurse.description: Whether to scan a directory recursively for manifests.

code.description: Determines whether the variable should be evaluated as jsonnet code or treated as string.

block.description: List of Jsonnet External Variables.

code.description: Determines whether the variable should be evaluated as jsonnet code or treated as string.

block.description: List of Jsonnet Top-level Arguments
Jsonnet specific options.

ignore_missing_value_files.description: Prevents 'helm template' from failing when `value_files` do not exist locally by not appending them to 'helm template --values'.

pass_credentials.description: If true then adds '--pass-credentials' to Helm commands to pass credentials to all domains.

release_name.description: Helm release name. If omitted it will use the application name.

skip_crds.description: Whether to skip custom resource definition installation step (Helm's [--skip-crds](https://helm.sh/docs/chart_best_practices/custom_resource_definitions/)).

value_files.description: List of Helm value files to use when generating a template.

values.description: Helm values to be passed to 'helm template', typically defined as a block.

path.description: Path to the file containing the values for the Helm parameter.

block.description: File parameters for the helm template.

force_string.description: Determines whether to tell Helm to interpret booleans and numbers as strings.

Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.

[Merge generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Merge/) combine parameters produced by the base (first) generator with matching parameter sets produced by subsequent generators. Take note of the [restrictions](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Merge/#restrictions) regarding their usage - particularly regarding nesting merge generators.

The application specification.
Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.

[Matrix generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Matrix/) combine the parameters generated by two child generators, iterating through every combination of each generator's generated parameters. Take note of the [restrictions](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Matrix/#restrictions) regarding their usage - particularly regarding nesting matrix generators.

merge_keys.description: Keys to merge into resulting parameter set.

config_map_ref.description: ConfigMap with the duck type definitions needed to retrieve the data this includes apiVersion(group/version), kind, matchKey and validation settings.

name.description: Resource name of the kind, group and version, defined in the `config_map_ref`.

requeue_after_seconds.description: How often to check for changes (in seconds). Default: 3min.

values.description: Arbitrary string key-value pairs which are passed directly as parameters to the template.

match_labels.description: A map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of `match_expressions`, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: A key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators ard `In`, `NotIn`, `Exists` and `DoesNotExist`.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

block.description: A list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.
Label selector used to find the resource defined in the `config_map_ref`. Alternative to `name`.

Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it. Default is 10.

block.description: Kubernetes object metadata for templated Application.

project.description: The project the application belongs to. Defaults to `default`.

revision_history_limit.description: Limits the number of items kept in the application's revision history, which is used for informational purposes as well as for rollbacks to previous versions. This should only be changed in exceptional circumstances. Setting to zero will store no history. This will reduce storage used. Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it. Default is 10.

name.description: Name of the target cluster. Can be used instead of `server`.

namespace.description: Target namespace for the application's resources. The namespace will only be set for namespace-scoped resources that have not set a value for .metadata.namespace.

server.description: URL of the target cluster and must be set to the Kubernetes control plane API.

block.description: Reference to the Kubernetes server and namespace in which the application will be deployed.

group.description: The Kubernetes resource Group to match for.

jq_path_expressions.description: List of JQ path expression strings targeting the field(s) to ignore.

json_pointers.description: List of JSONPaths strings targeting the field(s) to ignore.

kind.description: The Kubernetes resource Kind to match for.

name.description: The Kubernetes resource Name to match for.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes resource Namespace to match for.

block.description: Resources and their fields which should be ignored during comparison. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/diffing/#application-level-configuration.
List of information (URLs, email addresses, and plain text) that relates to the application.

chart.description: Helm chart name. Must be specified for applications sourced from a Helm repo.

path.description: Directory path within the repository. Only valid for applications sourced from Git.

ref.description: Reference to another `source` within defined sources. See associated documentation on [Helm value files from external Git repository](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/multiple_sources/#helm-value-files-from-external-git-repository) regarding combining `ref` with `path` and/or `chart`.

repo_url.description: URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests.

target_revision.description: Revision of the source to sync the application to. In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD. In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.

exclude.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly excluded from being used during manifest generation. This takes precedence over the `include` field. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{config.yaml,env-use2/*}'

include.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly included during manifest generation. If this field is set, only matching manifests will be included. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{*.yml,*.yaml}'

recurse.description: Whether to scan a directory recursively for manifests.

code.description: Determines whether the variable should be evaluated as jsonnet code or treated as string.

block.description: List of Jsonnet External Variables.

code.description: Determines whether the variable should be evaluated as jsonnet code or treated as string.

block.description: List of Jsonnet Top-level Arguments
Jsonnet specific options.
Path/directory specific options.

ignore_missing_value_files.description: Prevents 'helm template' from failing when `value_files` do not exist locally by not appending them to 'helm template --values'.

pass_credentials.description: If true then adds '--pass-credentials' to Helm commands to pass credentials to all domains.

release_name.description: Helm release name. If omitted it will use the application name.

skip_crds.description: Whether to skip custom resource definition installation step (Helm's [--skip-crds](https://helm.sh/docs/chart_best_practices/custom_resource_definitions/)).

value_files.description: List of Helm value files to use when generating a template.

values.description: Helm values to be passed to 'helm template', typically defined as a block.

path.description: Path to the file containing the values for the Helm parameter.

block.description: File parameters for the helm template.

force_string.description: Determines whether to tell Helm to interpret booleans and numbers as strings.

block.description: Helm parameters which are passed to the helm template command upon manifest generation.
Helm specific options.

common_annotations.description: List of additional annotations to add to rendered manifests.

common_labels.description: List of additional labels to add to rendered manifests.

images.description: List of Kustomize image override specifications.

name_prefix.description: Prefix appended to resources for Kustomize apps.

name_suffix.description: Suffix appended to resources for Kustomize apps.

version.description: Version of Kustomize to use for rendering manifests.

block.description: Kustomize specific options.

name.description: Name of the plugin. Only set the plugin name if the plugin is defined in `argocd-cm`. If the plugin is defined as a sidecar, omit the name. The plugin will be automatically matched with the Application according to the plugin's discovery rules.

block.description: Environment variables passed to the plugin.
Config management plugin specific options.
Location of the application's manifests or chart.

sync_options.description: List of sync options. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/sync-options/.

allow_empty.description: Allows apps have zero live resources.

prune.description: Whether to delete resources from the cluster that are not found in the sources anymore as part of automated sync.

self_heal.description: Whether to revert resources back to their desired state upon modification in the cluster.

block.description: Whether to automatically keep an application synced to the target revision.

annotations.description: Annotations to apply to the namespace.

labels.description: Labels to apply to the namespace.

block.description: Controls metadata in the given namespace (if `CreateNamespace=true`).

limit.description: Maximum number of attempts for retrying a failed sync. If set to 0, no retries will be performed.

duration.description: Duration is the amount to back off. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

factor.description: Factor to multiply the base duration after each failed retry.

max_duration.description: Maximum amount of time allowed for the backoff strategy. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

block.description: Controls how to backoff on subsequent retries of failed syncs.
Controls failed sync retry behavior.
Controls when and how a sync will be performed.
The application specification.
Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.

[List generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-List/) generate parameters based on an arbitrary list of key/value pairs (as long as the values are string values).

config_map_ref.description: ConfigMap with the duck type definitions needed to retrieve the data this includes apiVersion(group/version), kind, matchKey and validation settings.

name.description: Resource name of the kind, group and version, defined in the `config_map_ref`.

requeue_after_seconds.description: How often to check for changes (in seconds). Default: 3min.

values.description: Arbitrary string key-value pairs which are passed directly as parameters to the template.

match_labels.description: A map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of `match_expressions`, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: A key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators ard `In`, `NotIn`, `Exists` and `DoesNotExist`.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

block.description: A list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.
Label selector used to find the resource defined in the `config_map_ref`. Alternative to `name`.
